item.description:
What You’ll Experience in this class:

  • Simple Qi Gong movements for health and vitality
  • Self-massage and Relaxation

Get to know the power of  your body and mind through Qi Gong

Qi-Gong exercises were developed through centuries of thorough observations and experience of bringing "Qi" - life force energy -  into balance. They help release stress and restore the Qi flow without medical intervention.

Qi flows through a body via pathways, called energy meridians.

A sequence of movements, called a Qi-Gong form, can be designed to stimulate the particular meridians or all of them (20 in total) to remove the stagnation. Qi-Gong is often called “acupuncture without needles”.

Presently there are hundreds of forms and styles of Qi-Gong - Chinese, Korean (Ki-Gong) and Japanese (Kiko)- and they include tapping, stretching, twisting, slow motion movements and still postures. It’s better to start your daily Qi-Gong practice from simple forms that gently stimulate your body and are easy to learn.

Qi Gong movements provide an excellent stretch for every limb,  awaken your brain, clarify your mind,  and stimulate the energy flow throughout the entire body, but in a gentle, caring way.  This practice is a good choice if you are feeling sad or depressed, or at any time you want to open yourself up to a flow of positive energy.  It is a great way to release stress and recharge yourself with a smile.

All beginners of all ages are welcome to come to experience a simple QiGong class.

 

Please wear loose clothes, and have your dinner at least 30 mins before class.

See you soon!
item.name: Introduction to Qi Gong
